interpretation.p: All digital surrogates of the original source are linked with the markup textfile.
All Gaelic (and English) texts have an English summary, index terms, keywords, and, where applicable, a taxonomic reference.
For some Gaelic (and English) texts a bibliographic reference(s) will be provided to other sources.

correction.p: Errors from the original source transcription have been kept to a minimum by employing stringent quality control procedures. In addition, all texts have been proof‐read by the text editors.

A guiding principle of the Alexander Carmichael notebooks markup procedure is to approximate the original document as closely as possible, so that the character of Carmichael's transcriptions is preserved along with its content. XML (eXtensible Markup Language), with its capacity to convey emendations such as deletions (crossed out) and supralinear additions and so forth, can digitally reproduce an authentic version which reflects the source documents.
Where authorial changes, e.g. substitution, have occurred in the text then this has been annotated.
Where there are errors they have been corrected and words which were difficulty to decipher has been indicated

In such cases missing words or letters have been supplied. Quotation marks and other missing grammatical marks have in the main not been supplied. Where there are gaps in the text usually because the word was inaudible (some background noise, perhaps) or where the transcriber could not make out what was being said in the act of transcription (perhaps the speaker was inarticulate or mumbling or for whatever reason) then these have been tagged, though not explained; where a word is now difficult, illegible or just unclear, then this has also been tagged.
All such changes have been annotated in accordance with TEI 5 procedures.

normalization.p: No normalization of the words such as changing the source text to conform with current Gaelic orthographic conventions has been undertaken. The texts are as given with only minor editorial changes. in order to preserve the integrity of the original texts.

quotation.p: All opening quotation marks, hyphens, dashes, apostrophes, periods, colons, etc. have been retained in the source text and have been encoded in accodance with ISO entity references, etc.
All double marks have been processed using straight quotation marks, that is, ". All single quotation marks have been rendered using apostrophe.

hyphenation.p: End‐of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.of‐line hyphenation has been retained. All unambiguous end‐of‐line hyphens have been retained, and the trailing part of a word has not been joined to the preceding line.

segmentation.p: Folio numbers have been added in pencil at the top of each notebook page are retained using the pb (pagebreak) element together with the n attribute for the page number and the ed attribute to specify the edition.
When an tale‐text or song which, more often than not, fills more than one page, it is segmented with page break.

langUsage.language: Approximately 40% of the fieldnote and transcription bokos are Scottish Gaelic, and the remaining 60% consist of English or Scots, along with stray quotations in Latin.

div.p:
An Gruagach Ban
Mac Righ Eireann
Alastair (mac Ruair bhain) MacNeill
Saillear eisg Ceanntangval Barra
22d Marst 1871. AAlexander AArchibald Carmichael

Bha righ ann an EireanEireann uair
Bha e post agus cha d rug duine cloincloinne
dha. & bha e gailgabhail mulad nach rorobh duin
cloinecloinne gu bhith dha. An deideigh dha
dhol a chadchadal. OicheOidhche so thainic guth gu
ionionnsaigh a bhruithbruithinn ris & e na chadail
A Righ EirEireann ors an guth tha sibh a
gailgabhail mulmulad. Nach eil duine cloinecloinne
ga bhreith dhuibh. Ach beirbeirear mac
dhuibh s bheir Sibh an Gruagach
Ban mac righ EirEirinn mar ainainm eir
Bheir sibh cioch is glun us altro
Mas dha gu math scoil us ionionnsachadh mhic
righ us mid. GheoGheobh e aisearan gu leoir
ri linn dha tintighinn thun an t-saoghail
Thainig mac eir an Righ & thug
an Righ dha mar a shirdhiarr an guth
&c&c

Nuair a thainig e gu aois & gu fearach
as eir ac & gun taingtainig e gu feum duin
dha bhi e fhein & mor ual sinuaislean
nocnochd a falbh feofeodh na duchaduthcha cumail
cuirt & cuideaccuideachd leis. Ga h-ardein
le aoineasaoibhneas & le sollas o nach rorobh mac
aig an righ ach e fhein ga chum
ail ris. LaLatha dha na lachinlaitheachan dh falbhfhalbh
e fhein & mor uaislean na riocrioghachd
Eir dhaibh a bhi eir tom seilge anann
an diredeireadh an lalatha thionthionndaidh e eir an
tom sheilg gu tilleatilleadh dhachdhachaidh Thug e suil
bhuaibhuaith s eir coslas gu fac e fear
marcaiche fallaire duine. Eir
air a thionthionndaidh thug e air a cheann
chunngchunnaig e i eir choltas bean chaol
chott uaine ann an collas boirboireannaich
GhaGhabh i lom us direach far an rohrobh
Gruagach Ban BheanBheannaich i dhan GhrGhruagach
Bhan & bheanbheannaich an GGruagach Ban dhi ansanns
na briarabriathran ceanceana s mar bi iad a b fhear fhearr
chan iad bu mheasa. Mas e do
thoil suisuidh GGhruagaich Bhain airson treis di
versain. ShuiShuidh ad s cha rorobh ann
ach treis thoirt eir iomart chairtean
Chuir an GGruagach an cluiccluichd eir na
cairstean. Siudaibh a GhGhruagaich Bhain
Togaibh torradh ur cluich. Chan eil
mi fhein a faicfaicinn ors an GGruagach BBan gu bheil
toradh agam ri thogail. Tha rīocrioghachd
Eir fo m sparran s cha nilneil dragh
oroirre ach mi fhin. Tha or us airgairgiod gu
leoir ann stoc us iondasiongantas. Ach
mas toileachas leibh e gun toir sinsinn
treis eir na cairstcairtean. Thug ad sin agus
chuir ise an cluiccluichd. Siud pe ors
an GGruagach BBan togail tortoradh ur cluiche. Bhi
amas a sin ors ise usathusa bhibhith fo gheasgheasan
& fo chriosanchroisean fo naonaoidh buaraichean
mna sisith siulasiubhla seachran an
laogh beag is miota s as mi threo
raiche thoirt do chinn & do chluas
dhiot do chauchaitheamhbeabeatha dhiot mu ni
thu tamh na h-oicheh-oidhche far an tamh uthu 'n
lalatha s mu ni uthu tamh an lalatha far an tatamh uthu
an oicheoidhche gus anam faifaigh uthu mise gu de
be bi aite bheil mi fo ch 4 rannrannan
ruaruadh an t saoghail & thug i neapagin
geal as a poc & chrath i i & dh falbhfhalbh
i as a sheallshealladh & chocha rorobh fios aige co
dhiu shluig an talamh shios no
an t adhar shuas i s cha rorobh sian
an shealsealladh an t saoghail aige dhi
Thuit e fairis le mulmulad & le lionn
dudubh & le bron eirson e fhein a
dhiandhianamh mar a rinrinn e Dh-falbhDh-fhalbh e
fhein & mhor uaisluaislean dhachdhachaidh Chuir
e uileanuileann eir a bhord & leig e osna
Osna mhic righ fo gheasun os
athair gu de na geasun a th ort?
Tha geasgeasun orm agus nach urainurrainn
mi fhifhin gan togail. Na cuireadh
sin mulmulad na mi ghin orstort Tha
luingeas eir muir agams & car
lachcabhlach (arm tir) & cuir cuiridh mi gad mi
fhuasg fhuasgladh ad fhad sa mhaireas or us
airairgead storas no iondasiongantas dhomhs. Stoc
us iondasiongantas cuircuiridh mi dh-fhuasgdh-fhuasgladh nan
geasgeasun ad a mhic. An ta ors an gille
tha sibh gorgorach m athair san orms
tha na geasgeasun s gad a chuir sibh na
luing eir muir & an carlach eir
tir airson na geasgeasun a thogthogail diomdhiom
bith sin a tha oribhseoirbhse agus dh aoitefhaoite
nach tog ad na geasgeasun gad o chu
rist do chuid stoc us storais or
us iondaisiongantais airgid us bith sin
a dhidhith orstort & ma dh aoitefhaoidte nach tog ad
na geasgeasun. Ach gleigleidh m athair an
cuid agaibhse ach osan orms thu
na geasgeasan fiachfeuchaidh mi ri n togail. ChaidChaidh
iad an oicheoidhche sin san lar na mhair
each togaitogaidh e eir gu falbh. ChuirChuireadh
beganbeagan ann anam bundle dha & dh-
fhag e beanbeannachd aig athair s aig a
mhathair s aig muinntmuinntir a phalios.
Thog e eir & dh falbhfhalbh e gun saogh
gun leanabh. Thug e gu astar
s bha duadhdubhadh eir a bhonbhonnan s tolladh
air a bhrog an neoil gheala sheamh
air an lalatha falbh s neoil ghudadhordhubh dhath dhorch'
na h-oicheh-oidhche tintighinn nach rorobh e faicfaicinn ait
an stad no'n tamh e – an tug
e na 3 lalatha eir falafalbh dh oicheoidhche & do lalatha
Anamoch a 4th lalatha de chunnchunnaig ach
caistcaisteal treis bhuaibhuaith. SmaoinSmaointich e aige
fhefhein gun gagabhadh e dh ionionnsaigh a chaistchaisteil fiach
anam faighfaigheadh e tamh na h-oichh-oidhche ann
agus e feomach eir agus e eir
a sharachadh. Ghabh e sios a
dh-iondh-ionnsaigh a chaistchaisteil – ghabh e mumun
cuairt eir – cha rorobh e faicfaicinn dorust
no uinguinneag eir an reachreachadh duin staigh
Thill e suas on chaistchaisteal gu dudubh bron
ach trom eisleanach. Eir treiseag dha
dirdireadh suas gu de chual e ach gun
ro dorust ga fhosgfhosgladh. A Ghruagaich
Bhain a mhic RiRigh EirEireann na ceil
orm fear d ainme Cha cheil
mi ors esaesan S mi aan grgruagach BBan mac ririgh EEireann
gu dearbh. Tha cuirm lalatha & blianabliadhna
so a feitheadh ort eadar sin &
ceanceann lalatha & raidhe eadeadar sin & cnceann
lalatha & mios no gagagad nach fuifuiricheadh tu ach
lalatha & oicheoidhche se do bheatha gu fuifuiricheadh tu
& thei ceanceann risa-rithist. SmaoinSmaointich e e gum
bu choir dha fiach math ghailghabhail
o na thuairfhuair e e agus thill e & ghabh e
staigh. ChuirChuireadh biabiadh an aite chaithchaitheamh &
deoch an aite ol & ceol an aite eiseisdeachd
s bha e caithecaitheamh na ceir & na cuid."
Bha aona bhoirbhoireannach a gleigleidheadh a chaistchaisteil &
thuirt i ris – gad a dh fhuirichfhuiricheas tu gu
ceanceann 5 blianabliadhna cha bhi do bhiabhiadh no
d amhlan sa na smiosa na sid
ChaiChaidh e chadal e & rinn e leabaleabaidh
ceannarstceann-adhairt chaisealst s lag
na builsgein. Smaointich e so
aige fhein aige feoasfeabhas an aite
gungum fanfanadh e aone chola diag
a leigeil a sgios. Bha e 20 lalatha gun
seallsealladh fhaighfhaighinn a mach eir dorust no
eir uinguinneag. SmaoinSmaointich e sin aige fhefhein
gum bu shuarach dha fhefhein nach rorobh
e faighfaighinn sealladh eir an t saoghal
Bhuil ors ise GhBGhruagaich Bhain tha uthu a gaailgabhail mulmulad
nach eil uthu faighfaighinn sealsealladh an t saoghail
Thig ththusa a mach is dorust a so
& gheogheobh uthu seallsealladh an t saoghail. Gu
de n uine tha uthu saoilsaoilsinn tha uthu so a
GhrGhruagaich BhBhain Bhuil tha mi saoilsaoilsinn gu
bheil mi nist 20 lalatha so. Tha uthu dirdireach
lalatha s lelethbhlianabhliadhna so an diudiugh fhin
Gu de nis ma tha uthu gad fhaighinn
fhefhein Tha ors easeasan gu bheil mi ann
an smaoinsmaoint an ceartceart uair nach facafhaca
mi duil riamh a thilthilleadh mo lamh
An ta chan e sin as fhearr duit ach
till is taitaigh & ona thug thu n leleth bhlianabhliadhna
ann thoir a bhlianbhliadhna seo. Se bh anann
thill e staistaigh s cha deachaideachaidh a chuirm
no bhiabhiadh no al aulanannlan sna miosa
na bha i roimhe eir ac agus gun rorobh
e so uine ann & gun rorobh e smaoinsmaoinich
gun rorobh e mu raidhe ann ona
thainig e chiad uair gus an uair
mu dheireadh. Agus anns a
mhionaid an d rinrinn easan
an smaoint bha isfhios aige. A GhrGhruagaich
BhanBhain ors ise tha ththu gaailgabhail mulaid
Ach thig a mach a nist & gum faic
tu sealsealladh an t saoghail fhastfhathast. GhaGhabh e
mach. Bheil fhiostfhios agad a nist
gu de n uaine thug uthu so ors ise. Tha
mi ann an smaoint gu bheil
ceanceann an rairaithe mach. Chan e ors
ise tha uthu blianabliadhna net duin ors ise
Ach gus de mar tha uthu gad a fhaighfhaighinn
fhefhein nist Tha mi ann an son aon
an da bheinbheinn ad shuas nanan ruigruiginn
mo dha laimh orra gun togtogainn a
bheinbheinn bhiorach gun eir mulmullach
na beinebeinne maoile. A ghghruagaich ors ise
tha uthu na mhoracachmhor-fhaclach thutthuirt uthu roimroimhe
nach fhac uthu duil a thilthilleadh do lamh & tha
uthu n drast gun tog tu bheinbheinn bhiorbhiorach ud
shuas eir mulmullach na beinebeinne maoile
Ach os ise tha feoinfeodhainn ann a thilthilleadhdo
lamh. An ta tamh no fois mu
ni mi ona leig sibh a mach e gus
anam faifaigh mi mach cait bheil ad sin
Tha ad a sin buideinbuidhinn cruincruinn ris
an can ad an Fhinn. Tha lalatha bog
ceoarceothar ann an diugh & cha dean uthu
seilg a mulmullach bheann. Tha loch
shios a sidsiod s tha ad a ga iasgach
bhreac anns a bhagh le linnlin. Tha
tha Fionn MacCumhail air an
dara ceann na oraconrachd & an Fhinn
uile eir a cheann eil ga tharuintharruing
Agus mu dh fhalbhas tusa gagabh air tir
far a bheil Fionn na oraconrachd. Agus beanbeannaichidh
tu dha & beanbeannaichidh easeasan dhuit anns na
briarabriathran ceandacianda s mar h-iad is fhearfhearr
cha n iad is measamiosa. Tha 'n Fhinn
gle laidir air a casun an drast
IarIarraidh tu fasdadh eir Fionn & thog
sibh an du seasnach ri chuile
CuirCuiridh FionFionn ceist oirbh nach ionaghiongnadh
leis fear a bhibhith sirsireadh fastfhathast eir ach gu
de n t ammam a bheir. Tha fear m ainm
cha do cheil mi riariamh their thusa – An
GruagGruagach Ban mac RiRigh EirEireann Bheir
leat an neapaginneapagain beag ad a sidsiod
& beo no marbh gam bi thu thug
Fionn thug aire uthu don an neap
again Se bh ann dh falbhfhalbh e s dh
fagfhag e beanacbeannachd aice. GhaGhabh e lom us
direach roiroimhe. Cha b fhada chaichaidh e nuair
a chunchunnaic e Fionn eir an dala taotaobh &
an Fhinn uleuile eir an taotaobh eile GhaGhabh
e lom us dirdireach roimhe far an rorobh Fionn & bheanbheannaich
e dh FionnFhionn & bheanbheannaich Fionn da
&c &c Fhinn ic Cumhail thainic
mi gan ionionnsaigh eir son muinntireas
An ta tha 'n FhFheinn gle laidir eir aan cascasun
againns an trast s chan eil duin
gam dhitdhith os a FiFionn Ach chan ioniongnadh mi
uthu shishireadh muinireasmuinntireas ach gu de 'n t ainm tha ort
Fear m ainm cha do cheil mi riariamh
e – smi ors easeasan an GrGruagach BBan mac ririgh EEireann
Cha n ioniongnadh mi ors FFionn mise chan muintmuinntireas
s cha chan gad a gheogheobhadh tusa uam-sa ged
a dh-aitichin fear eile s gur h-ann
eir fearann t athar a thogadh na
suinn. ThoisThoisich ad ri taruintarruing an lin. Thug
an GGruagach BBan suil bhuaibhuaith s gu de chunchunnaic e
ach fiadh os a chionchionn An ta bu
bhriabhriagh dhuidhuibh fhfhein bha fiadh an fhin
ad a sidsiod s cha be bhi tartarruing lion e
mar so ann am bagh – Fear
a rug greim dha fheoil agus balg
am dha eanaraich. Thuirt mi
siol-chuin na ors a FiFionn gun bhibhith mo
ghaolach measg mo chuidchuideachd Fear
S mas math math am fiadh ad tha mo
sheacsheachd leoir agam eir fhaighfhaighinn dedheth mamar
tha. Ach targtarruing an lion a GhGhruagaich Bhain
os FFionn & thoisthoisich ad ri tartarruing an lion lin.
– Fionn & an GGruagach BBan air dara ceann an
lin & na Fian uile air a cheann eile
Thug An GrGruagach Ban an dala suil & chunchunnaig e aam
fiafiadh a casadh a nuas. O se mo chiad
iarrtas e bhibhith ro fhada nar comcomas
nan cuircuireadh sibh am fear briabriagh sin
agaibh ris an canar Caoilte eir
deoidhdeoghaidh an fheifheidh. Dh eubh FFionn a so eir
CCaoilte & thaingthainig CCaoilte Tha duin so eir tinntighinn
is taitaigh osas ur ors FFionn ris an canar
an GGruagach BBan mac ririgh EEireann & os se chiad iariarrtas
a tha e sirsireadh ort dol treis eir deoideoghaidh an
fheifheidh a chumail cuideaccuideachadh ris.
An ta suas aona anam fiafiadh sin ors
CaoiteCaoilte tha mi eoleolach gu leoir cheana
eirg. Dh-falbhDh-fhalbh CCaoilte & thug e gu astar
Fhinn ioc Chumail ors an GrGruagach BBan

rug e thom tamha? Tha 7 glinn

fios fiach ciamar tha CCaoilte air an fhiafhiadh
Tha da cheann eir CCaoilte chan eil

demardeamar tha CCaoilte air an fhiadh. Tha CCaoilte

ga thom tamh Tha 5 glinn us 5 mill
& 5 aite suisuidhe samhrsamhraidh as a dheoadheoghaidh & a
dha roiroimhe agus 5 cinn eir an fiafhiadh

Thugamid tacan eir tartarruing an lin.
FFhinn demardeamar tha am fiadh an trast
na na bheil roiroimhe dhan astastar. Tha
6 & 6 & 6 & aon ghleann & aona
mheall & 1 aite aige gun dol seachseachad
So so ors e s fhada liom tha mi
feithfeitheamh ri d liananlionan beag bronach
s ri d mheanabh iasg beag nan
rorobh mi eir falbh eir deoideoghaidh an fhefheidh

na thorr a sidsiod e s thog adsan leo
coire s dh falbhfhalbh ad eir deoideoghaidh GGruagach BBan
Shin an GGruagach BBan a mach & bheirbheireadh e ri
a ghaoighaoith lualuath Mhart bha roiroimhe 's cha
bheirbheireadh a ghaoghaoth lualuath Mhart bha as a

einich leibidich nam bibiodh fios am
nach deandeanadh tu ach mar seo cha
mhumhutha leigleiginn eir falafalbh thu na saigeadhsaighead
bi falafalbh amh Thug e gu astar Cha
b fhada bha gus am fac e am fiadh
a dol null eir clachan StruanSruthan
sua ruaruadh & am fiafiadh a leum far an t-samh
Rug e eir chalpa deirdeireadh eir an fhiadh
S thug am fiadh ran as. Thug
cailleach Clachan StruSruthan RuaRuadh
an a ranrann aiste. Leig ugamthugam mo
bheobheothach gaolgaolach. Agus a GhGhruagaich BBhain mhic
RiRigh EEireann cha rorobh gu beirbeireadh eir ach uthu
Ach leig ugam e no ni mi nas
miosa. Ma ni ors an GGruagach BBan chan
ann ormasa. Thug ise choille
orraoirre & bhuain i gad coille ma
choineamhchoinneamh chule duine bha
san Fhinn. Thug easan a
cheardach eir ceardach mhor
nan 2 7 goachagobhacha fichead. Thainig
easeasun s shin e 3 cearcail mu
cheann a chuile fir Thainig
ise sin leis na gaduin coille s le
duil s gun leigleigeadh ad thuice am
fiadh cha deach e gan cealceangal
GhaGhabh i mach & dh eubeubh e am
fiadh a leigleigeil thuice. Bhrist a
an treas cearcal bha mun a
ceann. Cha do chuir e cearcearcall
mu cheann Fhinn idir. This
she did 3 times & broke the 3 hoops. Nar
a chunchunnaic i sin dh-falbhdh-fhalbh i s thug
i leleatha na gadun 's chealaicheanglaidh i
chuile mac mathar bha san
Fhinn cul ri cul ach Fionn na oraconrachd Fhad
sa Bheil uthu ga fhaicfhaicinn sidsiod Fhinn
os GGruagach BBan Tha ors Fionn. Fhiuch fhir
nach do dh eitich nad do sgáth
a bhocbhochd no nocnochd riariamh thoir domhasdhomhsa
lan mo dhuirn ga chalg no

Cha tog s cha leag ach mar sidsiod

FFhinn ic CumhChumail ChaiChaidh FFionn eir a mhuin
Fiach a nist gu bheil uthu d dhedheogh

7 iomairean treoitreobhaidh Cha n eil

S mise gad d ionsionnsachadh. Thug e n ath

FFhinn ic CChumhnail nam faimidfaigheamaid is taitaigh eir

RaoinRinn FFhionn sidsiod & ghaghabh ad a dh ionionnsaigh an

3 uair. Chir e &c &c thug e dha

leum sin as s chaichaidh e seachad
eir barr an rampar. Tha
flath us failte aisears ise sidsiod romhromhad
ChaChaidh Fionn is taitaigh & bheannaich e an
t aite. FhreagFhreagair ise e anns na

deoch eir a bhialbhialaibh. Ghabh ad am

Chraobh. Cho moch sa chungchunnaig

an GGruagach BBan a muimuigh e Seadh FFhinn ic CChumail
thaine tusa. Thainig os FionFionn
Bhuil dad sam bibith fhuair
i sidsiod cha cheil i nist e san
LeonLeomhann ChraChraobh eir tintighinn dachdachaidh Dh' insDh' innis
ise chuille facal mar a dh
eireirich dhi mar bha i aige FFionn Tha'n
LLeomhann CCraobh a nist a tintighinn na chaorinchaorain dearg e
teine. Ach dhichuinichdhiochuimhnich e a leorleobhar
buitseacbuitseachd. Mar bhi na dichuimdhiochuimhnich e
sin cha rorobh duine bh eir an t saolsaoghal
nach cuircuireadh e gu bas. Thainig an
LLeomhann CraoCraobh & thoisthoisich e fhein & GGruagach BBan eir
a cheile. A chiad bhuille thug an GGruagach BBan
dha leag e cheann eir a shlin
ein. Leum e sin na theubh & eir
1 bhuille thug e dha leag e ristrithist a

e sin na sheoaogsheobhag anns na speurspeuran
an & leum GGruagach BBan as a dheoidheoghaidh] & a speech

agus thuit an GGruagach BBan as a dheoidheoghaidh marbh
gun diog gun smid. Ghearr a
sin Fionn am ploc mar a
dh-iarr ise bean a chaisteil &

an LeoinLeomhainn san LeoarLeobhar bhuistich
ean air a muin Fhinn ic CChumhail insinnis

an L.Leomhann C.Craobh Chan eil fios agams

GGruagach BBan & thug e leis e s rangranaig e'n
caisteal. ChoinChoinnich bean chaol
a chota uain e n dorust a chaistchaisteil
Shin esaesan di an neapneapagain GaGabh usathusa
Suas an rum ad shuas FhinFhinn
Cha b fhada bha i shuas nar thainig
i. Failt oirbh FhFhinn ic CChumaill ors ise
Failt oirbhse ors FFionn GunGu de neacnaidheachd

ors ise. Cha chual mi neacnaidheachd na

EEirinn bhibhith beo. Tha'n GGruagach BBan mac ririgh EEirinn beo
ors ise. Agus s fhearr dhomh ris

s gun ga aibhgabhaibh sibh ar dindinneir Chuir

Suidh aig an dindinneir ors bean
chaol chot uain. Cha suisuidh os

CailCailleach strusrutha ruairuaidh an toistoiseach Rainig
e sin bha banag eir tintighinn eir barbarr

SuiSuidhibh a nis aig an dindinneir ors easeasan
Theid mise nis dh-insdh-innis mo sgeul

easesan & dh inisinnis e dhi gun do thog

Thill easeasan s raingrainig e far an rorobh

Dh-falbhDh-fhalbh e fhefhein & Fionn & na
FianFianntaich & rainig ad an caiscaisteal Bi
Rinn mi nist FhFhinn gach ni

oirbh nist ach mi fhagail am

Ma ta mas sansann mar sin a tha

Thug dhachdhachaidh pearsa eageaglais & phos

ad s cha do dh'fhaadhdh'fhalbhadh

Heard this from his father
when a boy. l AlxrAlexander MacNeill is 72.
Wrote this tale while granting tax
Licences at Castlebay during spare
minutes & intervals

Ciosmal from John Peirsean
Keantangval. 23 March 1871

Niall Glundu'sGlundubh's father was travtravelling
in the south & he caldcalled at the Iarla BoidBoideach
who had a young datdaughter Niall Glundu'sGlundubh's fathfather
& Bute marmarried the two infants – Niall Glun
du & the Iarlas datdaughter. NNial Gl'sGlundubh's fathfather died
& did not tell him that he was marmarried
Niall GlunGlundubh was away with his galley
& called at Butes & told who he was
You should be welcome here
said Bute you are marrmarried to my
daughtdaughter. Not I said NNiall GlunGlundubh Yes &c.
If I see her & find that she pleases
me I may impleimplement my fathers bar
but not otherwise. The young lady
was produced & satisfied the young
Island chief & he brotbrought her home with
him. When Butes dautdaughter was confined
her father was advised of it & he came
to see her. In the old daingneachdaingneachd
that the MacNeills had they used to keep
men at arms & no person or boat could
appapproach the castle so all boats had to land
at Eilean dughdubh nan Còrr at Beinn
nan Clach-teine (Flint heap there) and
apprised MacNeill that such was their
Bute died so so his wife advised
GlunGlundubh to run away before her father
came & he did so. When Bute came his
datdaughter told him that her husband
had gone north. The banaltrom gave
him the child &c &c. Bute sent two
builders to build Ciosmal – Cul
is Beud so Baghan Chul-
Beud lies between the castle & Geo
Aird na moine on Gearragal on the inner
side of Sgeirean-chul a bhaile.
Leigemal is an isle close to EEilean dughdubh
nan Corr.

lg.l: M'fheadan us m eoin us m uighean
Mo leanaban beag banunban-fhionn buibuidh'
Mo luachair bhog eir an sui'ein
S mo bhogha s mo bhalachan (?bhalagan) s'uir?
S mo bhalachan dudubh ciar-uciar-dhubh
'S gun siulainsiubhlainn am fraoch leat
O thaobh nan tom uaine
O mo lur eibhin an t-samhrait-samhraidh – ghil uaine

div.p:
Coinneach nan Tarbh had 19 bull
calves one year & no quey calves – lived in
Sanntraigh. This man met the Luideag
the Barra name for the GlaissteagGlaisteag glaislig
or the Bean-sithidh at a stream AuinAbhainn na Baoibhe near
Siatar comgcoming frfrom Liat. he got the LuidLuideag
he got hrher up & rolled her in his plaid.
He She was kicking & screaming
& when she saw the light of the houses
she was still worse He then promispromised
to let her go if she would prompromise to herd
his cattle for a year & a day & allow none
of them to dith (call) To this she ac
ceeded tho hard. He let her go & for a
year & a day a white dog was seen up
the hill after the cattle a miolaranaich
sa caoiran and one incessant song
'us mo chaoidh Hōā hōā hōā mo chreach us mo chuaradh us m auraannradh
Chuir a bhuachaileacbhuachailleachd crodh Mhic
Gille choinichChoinnich mi. All the cattle
were kept safe & sound for a year & a
day & at the end of the next year not one
hoof was alive The door of the cuidh
fold would be found closed & open
night & morngmorning and no one seen about
doing this.

The son of MacPhie of Colonsay
a widower came here with his boy
after the dispessiondispossession of the Colonsay
family. MacNeill of Barra who
lived at Vaslan at the time took
him in as a buirderseach with
himself being a gentleman & he was
his manager. When no boat was
coming frfrom Miulay MacPhie was
sent over to see what was the matter
He found all the people dead. The
boatmen would not allow him
into the boat & they retreturned home with
out him. His boy began crying frfor
his father & a boat was sent with him
& the father & son remained in Miulay
for to themselves where their descend-
ants are. MacPhie buried all
the bodies which he found in the hoshouses
See other book for further descriptdescription.
The plague was said to have come frfrom
a wreck that came ashore in Miulay.

Tha mi nithe leine Marurir said
the Luideag. Tha mi fainfaighinn
faileadh nan tailean – leig as mi
Mhic Ille ChoinchChoinnich – Cha fhreagair
e dhomh.

DonlDomhnall Gorm Mor Shleibhte was away
in the army. This mans son – i e
DonlDomhnall Gorm Og saw his father &
his men & told his father
(The moil on the west coast
were raised 60 yrsyearsago in one night)
Fuais e fuais e dhaoin
uaisl 's fhearr dhuinn bhi
falbh. Cha n e ar beathbeatha so. BhBha
mi n Dun eideaneideann an rairraoir
tha mi m thalla fhein a nocnochd is
umad mòna-man a ghrein chan
eil a chli ann am chorp
'S mar bhi na coilean gruaigruaidh
s fhada bu chumha mo chaoin uthu.
Twas his father old fear-comhant
that told the son to turn the face
of every chair to the wall & light the giusgiuthais
candles.

Nighean MhicGillechalum
Rarsay drownddrowned a long in passing
by swirling her umbrella in a toin
coinich. She was drained of blood by
her fathers request bled to death in the
soles of her feet in warm water by her two
brothsbrothers who were young doctors. After that the 2
brobrothers went to India. Your worse than
Nic a Phie Cholasay said her fathfather
Macleods datdaughter was only 18 yrsyears.

Ann am nionaig bheag oig
O deanamid misneachd
Se gliocas us coir
Gur a farsing an saoghal
S ioma laogh thug a cro

S glan an dearsaidearrsadh tha d aodanaodann
Och us och ma atha mi
Sin n trast gad fhior smaoin
S leat mise mar ghealaich

S leat mise mar caill mi
Na bheil agam am chiabhchliabh
Ga boil leis a chailich
Eir a bheil an ceanceann lialiath
S leat mi eir a leabaileabaidh

Leat mi bhibhith slan
S leat mise mar miste

S mar bhibhith eagal na cleirel riut
Agus curam chaiche
Bu leat mi eir a leabaileabaidh

Se na chuaichein rè

Agus Seonaid on Cholla

Eir an suisuidheadh ClanClann Neil
Be sin na fir ghasda

Gun chaismeacchaismeachd gun stri
'S nar thigin san rathad

div.p:
Composed by the first James
of Boisdale who got Boisdale
aftafter the MacNeills. This was a datdaughter
of Donald son of MacNeill Barra
who was marmarried to Fionaghal mhor
datdaughter of Clanranald. Fionaghal
mhor was sistsister to ClanClanranald who
was shot on Sheriffmuir.

Her Shefather had only a life rent of Ben
becula so his people wldwould not
allow James of Boisdale to marymarry
Seonaid as her she had no land.
So they sent her to Ireland & she marmarried
mac Iarl Antruim. He marmarried
a datdaughter of Macleod of Harris – his
own nieannighean bhrathar a mhairmhathar –
the mother of Gordon & Ailean. Mor
ninighean Ruairi na h-Earradh.

Mac O Croileagan
Sgial Choise Cein
from Patrick Smith SSouth Boisdale
or Leth mheanach SSouth Uist Saturday
26th 25thMarch 1871 in his own house.

Bha O Croileagan na dhruma
(fear aineaithne) ris na h-eich aig righ
Lochlan & dheugdh'eug e & bha mac aige
& thuirt a mac ri mhairmhathair Saol
a mhairmhathair gu de tha mi smaointsmaointeachadh
Cha neil fios am ors a mhathrmhathair
Tha dol far bheil RiRigh LochLochlainn fiach
am faigh mi am post bha aig
m athar Dh albhfhalbh e & choinnchoinnich
RRigh LochLochlainn e An tu so mhic O
CroilCroileagan & aineaithne aig air. Ta s mi
ors easeasan. Cait a laochain an
rorobh uthu dol. Ta ars an gille tha
mi dol fiach am faigh mi
post bha aig m athar. De am
post bha sin. Nach rorobh e na
dhruma ris an h-eich. An ta
bha mhath t aire aig sin
& gheogheobh ththu am post & thig mair
each s gun ga agabhadh tu bracaist
airson na h-eich. Dh albhfhalbh Mac
O CroilCroileagan dhachdhachaidh & dh innis a dha
mhairmhathair gun d uairfhuair e mam post
bha aig airathair o RiRigh LochLochlainn Air la
na mhaireach dar bha e falbh
thuirt a mhairmhathair ris Tha uthu falafalbh mhic
Tha An ta na gagabh a mharcacmharcachd
ach an lothag bheag lacunnlachdunn
sin a bhios a falafalbh cuidcuide ris na h-eich
Dh albhfhalbh e s theirg easeasan eir muin
na lothaig bheag lacuinnlachduinnbhios a
falafalbh cuidcuide ris na h-eich. Bheil uthu
d mharcmharcaiche math ors RiRigh LochLochlan ris
Mac O CroilCroileagan. Tha mi ors eaas easeasan
Dh albhfhalbh ise an lo fhalaire si na
falaire bhriagh dhuidhuibh fothafoidhe. Cha
rorobh fios aigaige fon t saoghal gu de n
t astar bha i a diandianamh no gu de am
fearanfearann bha i falafalbh eir ChungChunnaig

Thug e nan seabad dh aint bheirst

ain gan iarriarraidhAch gu de n

b bafadfhada bha mi sidsiod nar thaingthainig gille mor

eircheirich mi nam sheassheasamh s chaichaidh sinsinn

h urrad do thair dhomhsa
An tha their ad riums mac
Gruagach na Falaire
Deirge. Done done mhic GrugGruagach na Falaire Deirge

air a cheile fona thainig

ChaiChaidh sinsinn ars taitaigh. Cha b adafhada

Dh eirich mise gus a shishireadh na bu

ThoisThoisich an distdithist olach eir a cheile
Thuirt mi fhein a so nuair

fear toirt snasadh as an fhear
eile. Fhir thainig dhachaidhachaidh mu

co uthu no camarciamar their ad riut nar
tha uthu toirt na tair sin gam
mhac. An ta ors easeasan their ad rium
Mac GruagGruagach na FFalaraidh ileGile Done done
dona mhic Gruagach na FFalaraidh GGile thu fhein
s do bhrathbhrathair g obair eir a cheile
So nuair a fhuair sinn an
cairdeas a cheile – mi fhifhin
S mo dhitdhithist macmhac. Dh albhfhalbh
a chuile fear a so & fhuair
a chuile fear a mharmhathair fhein
Sin thus do chas a Chein
S gum barr lui &c &c sann
ga leasleigheas a thaine mi. Shin
Cian mac AinAmain & leasleigheas a chas

ChaiChaidh mac RiRigh na Greige dh'iardh'iarraidh
niannighean RiRigh na Fraing ra posposadh. Phos e i
& rug i mac dha – bha mac eatorra
& cha rorobh ac ach e fhein. Dh eug mac
RiRigh GregGreige & a bhean. Mac a dh agfhag e
sin sgriobh e dh iariarraidh bhrairbhrathair a
mharmhathar tric gu choidchoimhead dhan Ghreig
as an Fhraing &. ThaingThainig a fear
sin ga chiodchoimhead & thug e leis a dha
12 cholta & 12 fhalaire fo afodha Bha
Mac RiRigh na Frainge & a 12 cholta a
marcmarcachd gu dian fada an la & bha
fear falaire amuigh romhpa
ghlaighlaoidh e orra fada an lalatha Stad ad an
oicheoidhche sin an taitaigh cairstealan.
Sa mhadmhadainn chaichaidh mamac RiRigh na FFrainge macmach
& bharbha fear a staireacstairireachd mun
dorust & thuirt e ris S math
mharcmharcaicheas tu mhic RiRigh na FFrainge Seadh
ach s fhearr na sin mharcmharcaicheas
fear na falfalaire duiduibh bha so an ann
an de. S mise bha sin. An
creic uthu nan fhalfhalaraidh Tha mi coma
gad a chreiceas moma gheogheobh mi
pris mhamhath orraoirre. Gu de bhios
tu g iarriarraidh Tha mi coma gad
do phasphaigheas mi do 12 pholtas &
do 12 fhalfhalaraidh fo'afodha. GheoGheobh ththu sin & thug
e sidsiod dha. Thug e sin a mach
an fhalfhalaraidh dhudhubh & dh albhfhalbh eir a
muin Bheil ththu d mharcmharcaiche mamath
mhic RRigh na FFrainge ors an fhalfhalaraidh dhudhubh s i
labhairt ris. Chan eil mi dona.
Dh albhfhalbh ise na deandeann an uair
sin. Bha ad a nis a falbh & thaingthainig
an oicheoidhche orra. ChungChunnaig ad a sin
solust & rainrinn ad eir Nuair
a raingrainig ad an solust cha
rorobh taitaigh no turlach ann. Chrom
e sin far an rorobh e faicfaicinn an t solust
s nuair fhuarfhuair e 'n solust
de bhanbh' ann ach gas gruaige
Tha solust a so a gas gruaige
& bheir mi liom e. An ta ors
ise cha be mo chomhairle dhuit
Bheir mi liom e eir a shon ?
& chuir e na leos poc e. Dh albhfhalbh
ad a sin eir a mharcmharcachd & fada
goirid ga rorobh e uauaithe rainig ad
a ghreig. Thuirt ise ris faigh
ailt fanacach dhomh
fhifhin no ma chuirchuireas tu n stabulstabull
cocomhla ris na h-eich eile mi marcmarcaichidh
ad orm & bi fhein tric a choidchoimhead
orm. Ni mi sin. RaingRainig ad
a ghreig s bha taing sgaoilte
rompa. Dhiarr e aite dhan fanacach
dhan falfhalaraidh& fhuair e sidsiod. Bhiodh
e sin a chuile h-oicheh-oidhche dol ga coidcoimhead
s cha bhiodh e toirt leis solust
idir Bhatar a sin toirt an
aire dha ? e toirt leis solust
& solsolust bhibhith aige chuile h-oicheh-oidhche
nasmas ruigruigeadh e an fhalfhalaraidh ChaiChaidh solsolust sgial
thun an ririgh & chaichaidh a ririgh so as a a
dheoidheoigh. Thuirt an ririgh so ris duair
thaingthainig e mach as an stabulstabull
gun de nan solsolust bha aige ann an
sid gun solust aige Chaneil
ach crimeaccriomag do choingheālcoinn
cheire s cha theirg i orm o na

Iain Iomairstagh was not the
one who built CaistCaisteal Chalavay but
"Iain" from elsewhere who used to
creach all vessels pasgpassing & imprison
the people in the toll dughdubh. At last
he was surdsurrounded & he fled to Kealach Iar
& a woman threw a stone frfrom above which
killed him

Ciosmal was built by Iain
Iomarstach & when findfinished he
said to Mac a Chreachar nach
briabriagh a caistcaisteal oirre Seadh ach bi e
fhastfhathast fo ghearrai bhiast dudubh so
fo eoin an adhar. He was sent to Maol
dondomhnaich

Dhun Dun Dhallabrig
Mac iain ic Sheumais lived at ErsEriskay
& used to go about with Alastair mor nam
marstmart.
Seonaid neannighean Iain ic DhonilDhomhnaill Ghuirm
Shleibhte was marmarried to AlexrAlexander mor nam
marstmart.

Fear Hamera frfrom Skye had Tir
Unga an IocairIochdair. AlastAlastair mor
sent word to fear Hamera not to come
across Cuan UistUibhist as long as he lived
Fear HeamHeameara then sent a challenge
to AlastAlastair mor to meet him at AuinAbhainn
Snizort Skye & he went. They were all
AlastAlastair mor went & his opopponent did not
appear. He saw a dog passing & he kildkilled
& hanged it up to a tree He wrote upon the
dog & Sir Tormad was a coward &
he retreturned home

Roacabarrai. The grandfather of
old Donald MacInnonMacKinnon aged 98½ years
Grianaig Dallabrig went an faoifaoighe-
chaorach went along with Mor mhor
ninighean MhicLeoid na h Earradh when
she married to RaoulRaghnall Mor mac ic AilAilein
They went to Bearnay & DonlDomhnall mac
Iain ic Lachlan ic IomarIomhair to
a house. He heard an ochan at the
back of a chest. Is that a poor sick man
said he yes said the voice & if you will
give me a bit tobacco Ill tell you
a story of Rocabarray. 3 others & I
went to Kill (bioraich here poor old
Donald Macphie MacInnonMacKinnon fell
on the floor off his stool in a swoon
& I thought he was dead. There were
only two little children in a boy & a girl
& I requestrequested them to run for the neighbours
I raised the old mans head & placdplaced
a bag with some diasun bere
heads under his head. He vomited
spe A neighneighbouring woman came but
she seemed as scared as myself
I placed 2/- in his hand & left.
Poor man! So Death would be a relief
from such wretched poverty & rags & dis
order & dirt. Wretched! wretched! wretched!
bioraichean (dog fish?) When out some
time we lost sight of land from a thick
mist that fell upon us. We were sailgsailing
& rowing & at long last we espied land
close by us & we landed. The people
of the place met us on the strand & carcarried
us to their houses & kept us there & told

div.p:
From Duncan Macdonald
86 Snaoisval MarMarch 28, 1871

This was compcomposed by an ai insane
girl who became insane about
a young man with whom she
was in love. She used to live with
the deer in Beinnmor. He woldwould
not be alowdallowed to marymarry her, & she went
in "fiadhair". Her people begged him
to shoot her so & not to be thus a heart
break to them. He went to the hill to shoot
her & he built a hut in which he lived
while he was hunting her. She came to the
hut when he was absent & on his return
he found her asleep lying on the floor.
He wakened her tenderly & on looking up
she recognised him & was perfectly sane
& on repeatgrepeating this she died in his arms.
She was perfectly naked. & died from
shame.

Airi-naAiridh h-aon-oicheh-aon-oidhche. A man MacPhie
lived in Benbecula & he had a dog & the
dog grew up a large animal & he never
barked. EvyEvery perperson was expressing a sur
prise that the dog was never barking
but MacPhie would only say never mind
the black dog's day's is not come yet. Coma
leibh tha là choin duiduibh gun tighinn
fhastfhathast So time passed on & MacPhie
who was known as MacPhie of the
black dog, Mac a Phi a choin
duighduibh – built an airiairidh shamhraishamhraidh
out south of Staireval When finedfinished
he & his da chomhalta dhiag men
(some say women) went to the airiairidh
They all lay down each in his bed
& each said that he wished he had
now his leannan with him Don e
don e bad bad have you wished said MacPhie to have
brobrought the upon us & he flew out of the airiairidh to the
utter astonismhment of this coaltuncomh-dhaltan & the
cu-dughcu-dubh after him. He had hardly got
out when twelve witches in the form
of women but with goib (beaks)
chnamha flew in upon his coaltcoaltun
& another went after him. He set (stuig e)
his cu dudubh at her & he himself flew
home. He requestrequested 4 boynes miasrach
(miasraichean) bainebainne to be set outside
the house door to be there on the arrival of the
cu dudubh. This was done & aftafter a while the
dog came He flew at the milk & licked
licked lapped (làp) e su up the 3 of
the boynes & on the fourth burst. He
was raving (mad) (conàdh) conà thuil
(raving flood) & not a hair left upon
him. Early in the morngmorning people rushed
to Airi-naAiridh-na h-aon-oicheh-aon-oidhche to asctascertain the fate
of MacPhies 12 co-altun & found there were
12 stackstacked dead some say with their
throat cut & drained of the blood &
others say with not a wound but the wounds
the gob-chnamha the bone-beacked
flictedinflicted upon them & not a drop of blood
left in them The airiairidh was abandonabandoned
& never more used & so the name.

(page 87) no that were in Rōc
a-barai When there a year & a day
one & of us saw a vessel passing & he wished
to be on board kind as the Roacabarai
people were. They understunderstood his wish
& they sent him out. In the course
of another year & a day another
of us saw a ship & he also said
O ririgh nach robh mis eir bord na
te ad ga be ceann an t saoghal gu
bheil i dol seoladh bu mhath e
seach so. at the end of ananother year & a
day they sent me & the other home to the
utter astonishment of all our friends
& here I still am alive to tell the adventure
of the occasion when I went to the Hàf
haaf to fish bioraichean.

Pabbay was inhabtinhabited by I'urIomhar a bhobhogha mhadmhaide
a son of [ded: ??] at MacPhie who came frfrom conycolonsay was his friend frfrom Rocabarai came
to see him till he I'urIomhar asked him
to stand goiste to his child. The
man declined but I'urIomhar pressed
him & ultiultimately the man consentconsented.
But when the priest came & perfperformed
the ceremony the man handed his dalt
to the I'urIomhar & told him – Now I consent to
stand goiste to your child because
you pressed me to do so. But I now
leave for Rocabarai & shall never
come to see you again for I have
stood goiste to yryour child & have listlistened
to the prayer of the priest (urnighurnaigh
na perspears eaglais) & my saint have
left me. But I leave you a mark
of my good will that as long as any
of yryour race (trétréubh) remains in Pabbay
neither mouse nor rat nor ver
minous creatures shall live in tit
& should they come there they shall
die. The man vanished & was never
seen again. As long as any of I'urIomhar's
race were in Pabby no mouse nor
rat lived there but now the island
is overrun.

Druim na h-uamh Valacui April 1871
A cartload of animal bones thrown out,
bones of the ox sheep swine deer & deer horns bits of
pottery some of which is ornamented whelks and
gilseacha fionndrim limpets razor-fish
strubain (cailleagun) cockles. The half
of a quern found. Granite much decayed
& crumbling showing how long ago it must
have made meal for its original owner.
The roof overlaps & many of the gneisgneiss or
granite stones are broken across frfrom
the weight above. Depth of sand above

Bearnaray Harris Saturday 29 April 1871
Mrs Macneill Newton & her sister Miss Fanny
Macdonald Scolpaig & her brother Mr Mac
donald Newton. Among the shell mounds
on Borve machair. What were these
archaic ruins? Heaps of stones here & there
& rows of stones on edge generally in a
circle or obl asp a sphere some large
as a cornyard & some small as a grave
heaps of shells whelks, limpets clambs razor
fish especially limpets & wilks. Heaps of
red (peat?) ashes bones of animals splin
tered to get at the marrow. Human bones
also fdfound. Circles with the flags on edge
whatever they?

Copper Brooch given by Flora
Macdonald to Isobel Macdonald
who lived at Airi vulin & who was
taken into Airivulin house by Flora.
This Isobel knew Flora well. This
Isobel was left an orphan 3 orphans when taken
in hand by Flora. It was then Flora
gave her this brooch. When Flora
married this Isobal niannighean RaoilRaghnaill
married one Eown Ross – Eoin
mac FhionnlaiFhionnlaigh. She this Isobel
lived till in the year 1863 – or 4. Her son
DonlDomhnall mac Eown mac FhionnlaiFhionnlaigh
(Ross) her died in 1866 aged 80. She used
to tell many things she
heard talked of at in
the house at Airivulin
about Flora and the Prince when she
was a little girl.

div.p:
Nighean RiRigh Bhaile an t-Sneact-Sneachd
From ArchiArchie MacPherson (an Gille
Bàn) pauper Trumsgearry age 76, 17 MarMay 1871

Mac RiRigh & cha rorobh mac no ninnighean aig
air ach e fhefhein. Bha e lalatha sa mhadinmhaduinn
gun eireirigh. Se bhiodh a cuartcuairteachadh a bhaile sa mhadmaduinn Bha anasannas mor eir airathair
s eir a mhairmhathair nach rorobh e g eiridh
ChaiChaidh a mhairmhathair a suas dhan chul taitaigh
san rorobh e na lailaigh & dh feorfheoraich i dhe car
son nach rorobh e g eirieirigh. Cha'n eireirich mise
gu brachbrath ors easeasan mar faifaigh mi ri
phosphosadh an te eir an rorobh mi smaoinsmaoineachadh
Se sin os easeasan tha craobh a muigh
ad & tha ualubhal orra s tha fieachfitheach am barbarr
na creibhcraoibh & tha sneacsneachd og air an lar
& gus am faigh mise bean eir am
bi gruag cho duigheduibhe ris an an fhithfhitheach
a gruaigruaidh cho dearg ris an ubhal
La cneas cho gile ris an t-sneacht-sneachd
Cha tamh oicheoidhche s chan fhuirich
lalatha dhomh. Tha uthu cur crois ort fhefhein
a mhic ors a mhairmhathair ach thig
a staistaigh far bheil t athair. Thaing e staistaigh
Tha uthu cur crois ort a mhic iomaiomadh
fear a chaichaidh eir sailibhsaillibh na te sin
nach do thill eir nais. RainRinn a mhamhathair
bonnach dha agus dh fhfhalbh e Bha
e falbh gus an rorobh du aghdubhadh eir a bhonbhonnach
& tolladh eir a bhrogan. ChunChunnaic e sidsiod
bothan beag shios ri bord an loch
& ghaghabh e sios lom is dirdireach ga ionionnsaidh
& ghaghabh e steach. Bha anasannas mor eir
fear an taitaigh fear a thinthighinn an rathad
san t aite cho uaigneach SuiSuidh
ors easeasan s fhada bho nach taintainig stranger
no neach eolach eir an astar so.
Dh iariarr a sin fear an taitaigh burn blablath
chur eir a chasun s burn bog
eir a la'unlamhan s plaideacha mine
molach ra leasraibh. GhaGhabh ad an
suipeir & chaichaidh ad a chadal Nist
Dh innis mac an ririgh a'airaobhar a
thurais don ianadair – gur h-ann
dol eir torr neannighean RiRigh Bhail an t-
SneacSneachd bha e S iomaiomadh fear thainig a
sin ors an t ianianadair gun mhoran ac
eir a shon Ach ma dh-fhaoite gun
tus is fhearr sealbh. SeinniSeinnidh mise
an fhideag sa mhadmhaduinn & thig niannighean
bho Bhaile an t sneacsneachd agus a 2 mhnamhnathan
coimheadaccoimheadachd gam faraigeadh
fhefhein anns an loch. FagFagaidh ad an cuid
aodaich ri bord an loch. Bi thus
taptapaidh & dian greim air an adachaodach
& na toir dhaibh e gus an tig a chuile
te dhiudhiubh air tir bho'n t snamh agus
an toir i 3 pogun duitdhuit. (Repeat
this 3 sucessive days) beanbeannaich dhuitsa s molacmollachd a bhial An 3 lalatha thug
t-ionsachait-ionnsachaidh
neannighean an ririgh sporan lan oir us airgairgid
dhan ghille & thuirt i riss math
tha fios agam gu de thug a so uthu
S iomaiomadh fear a thainig eir mo thoirsa nach
do thill riamh eir ais beo. Ach dean
thusa mar a shir mise ort & madhmath dh'
fhaoite gun cinnich leats nas
fhearfhearr na chinnich leosan S mi
ni ors easeasan. So thuirt ors ise or us
airgairgiod & sgeadsgeadaich thu fhein gu math
& thig a nios thun palios m marathar &
bi staireacstairireachd eir bial an dorustdoraist. CuirCuiridh
eas a mach am page fiach gu de
tha gad dhidhith (underlined: She told him how to act)
SgeadSgeadaich mac an ririgh e fhein gu math
s bha e sa mhadmhadainn a stairstairireachd eir bial dorust
an RiRigh Seall a mach de tha dhidhith an fhear
ad. Tha gnoachgnothach agam ris an RiRigh. Thig
a staistaigh De fāfāth do thurais nuas ars
an RiRigh Dh'inisDh'innis an gille gun rorobh e air
son a nighne ra posposadh Ha ors an RiRigh
s iomaiomadh fear thainig eir an turas
sin romhads a bhunaichbhuannaich gle bheag
eir a sin. Ach falathalla tha bathach
mhor 17 ceailceanglaichean shuas ad nach deach
a charstadhchairteadh o chionn 7 blianabliadhna agus
biadhbithibh i cho lom ri cricridhe na dearna eir
chor s gun ruiruith an ualubhal ghlas on darna
ceann gus an ceann eileile mun eireirich
mi sa mhadmhadainn. ChaiChaidh easeasan a mach
a choidchoimhead a bhatheachbhathach s i lan a suas
gus na taomain. Leig easeasan osna
throm s co bh eir a chulchulaibh ach ise. Osna
mhic ririgh fo gheasgheasaibh ors ise Gu de so tha
a'oraobhar t osna mhic an ririgh Dh innis
e dhi MarMur dean mis e cha dean sathusa e
os ise Fhuair i sin croman & sluas
aid & thilg i staistaigh eir mulachmullach an taitaighe
ad Duisg duisg a chromain s cuir
a mach a shluasaid ors ise Nuair
a dh-eirdh-eirich an RiRigh sa mhadmhadainn chuir e fios
eir mac an RiRigh. Seadh an do charst
uthu am batheachbathach? CharstChairt ars easeasan CharstChairt
ars am page tha dun shuas a sidsiod
uiruibhir ri caisteal. BeanBeannaich sin duitdhuit
On mollacmollachd a bhial d ionionnsaigh TughaiTughaidh
tu nis am batheachbathach ors an RiRigh – an ite
bheag an iocariochdar san ite mhor an
uacaruachdar a bun sios sa barr suas
ChaiChaidh eas a mach Leig e osna
throm Geas Osna mhic RiRigh fo
gheasgheasaibh os ise s i air a chulchulaibh Cha
rorobh riariamh gus a nocnochd ors easeasan Dh ininnis e
dhi an gniamhgniomh bha ma choinchoinneamh
Dean usathusa mar a shir mise ort
Ni ChaiChaidh ad a tharuintharuing mhoine
narnuair a chaidil cacha Chuir ad
teine mor mor air. Nist ors ise
cuircuiridh tustusa mise san teine so agus
narnuair a loisgeas mi gu luath sein
idhseinnidh tu an fhideag so & i sinsineadh
fiadagfeadag na lamhlaimh & cha bhi ian
san ealtain nach tig mun
chuartchuairt orstort CrathCrathaidh na h-eoin ad
fhein & s gus an crath aid dhiu
na h-itean & stadstadaidh na h itean eir a bhathbhathaich
Fiach nona chunngchunnaig uthu riariamh nach ligleig
uthu leis na h-eoin sgath dham lualuath
thogail leo narnuair bhios iad gun d
chloimh gun ite dumhlach
adh mu chuartchuairt & thug i dha slatag
bheag gus na h-eoin a chumail air
falbh. Rinn e mar a shirshirte risrithese eir
Thruis na h-eoin mu chuartchuairt
an teine & bha lan obair aige an
cumail air falbh & bha ghorrachorra
ghri eachghritheach gu sonruichte mibh-eil [mi-mhodhail]
& thug i tiolam eir lan a guib an
luath thoirt lea. Leig easeasan a sin lailaigh
broin us bais eir fhein a thaobh e
bhibhith cho cearbach sgun do ligleig e
leis a ch ghorra ghrichorra ghrithich sidsiod a dheandheanamh
& a thaobh ise bhibhith ga dhidhith & leig e e fhefhein
na shinshineadh a sios taotaobh an teine & thuit
e na chadal. Co thaingthainig ach am
boirboireannach. Don e don e mhic an ririgh
mo lualuath leigleigeil leis a chorr ghrichorra ghrithich s tu
nad chadal. Ach s mamath rainrinn uthu
Seall mo ludag choise dhiom
leis a chorrchorra ghrithich Seall a mach ors an
RiRigh fiach an do thuthugh e am babathach Rinn
e sin & shirshirte eir mac an ririgh dol as
taitaigh an uaruair sin. an d thuth ach uthu
bhathbhathach ThuThugh BeanBeannaich dhutsa s molmollachd
a bhial d ionionnsaigh Tha tarbh coa'aoichcaothaich ananns
a choille nach tig an gaoth ann
mar 7 mile gun a chir sa ghru-
an [ghruthan] bhibhith mach eir a bhial s cha deach
duine beo na ghaoghaoith bho chionn 7
blianabliadhna a marmur toir thus thugam
e an tarbh cuircuiridh mi do cheann
eir stop. Thill easeasan mach s ligleig e
osna throm Don e don e mhic
an ririgh osna mhic RiRigh fo gheasgheasaibh – Cha
bu gheasgheasaibh riariamh gus a nocnochd e S math
nocnochd fhein e So ors ise staoim nann
s duair bhios an taratarbh cao'aoichcaothaich gad
tharuntharraing ga ionionnsaidh crath so ris & thig
easeasan & cuircuiridh e a cheann nad achlais
Bheir uthu sin thun palios m athar

An Teampul Mor
Pabbay Harris. The
West gable & the two sides
are up and almost prefect.
The east gable is com
pletely down and the stones
seem to have been carried
awyaway. The east ends of the
side walls bulge out
very considerably. The
temple seems to have been
lengthened. The north side
about the middle shows
a rent and a different
thickness. The building
was got up inside boards
as concrete cement is
used now.

figure.figDesc: Rough stetch of An Teampul Mor

div.title: Bhean Shīth
div.p:
A man courted a fairy & then marmarried a
maiden of the sons of men. His wife
got dor torrach & he went for a bean
ghlun. On his wifeway he met the fairy
Chunna mi said he gobhar sa
chro ud thall s i gu bhibhith marbh
a breith meinn. Mata s neoneonach liom
sa sin a ghoarghobhar bhibhith cho bocbochd san
munngan (birth) fo cois ach chchan
eil fios nach i do bhean fhin a
th ann. Mata &c. So dhuits mata
crios agus cuir mud mhnaoi
e agus cha bhi cridcnead orra. He took
the crios & on his way he put the crios
round a stone & the stone split on in
bits. He then pulled the munngan
& placed it under his wifes foot & she
brotbrought forth a son & she was all right.

A Mhuillearstach
From Donald Maclellan
(DonlDomhnalllmac Iain bhain ic Neil) SSouth
Hacleit Benbecula, SSouth Uist age 84. 20 OctOctober 1871

The Muillearstach was the daughter of the
King of Lochlan and having heard much
about the Feinne she was anxious to test their
reputation in a fight and she came to
fight them accordingly. The Feinne
happened to be on a hunting excursion
in Ireland at the time.

Donald Maclellan (MacGilliallain)
heard the Muillearstach from his father
"Iain ban mac Neil" – a man who
had a great deal of old Fenian lore.
Maclellan himself has a good deal
and has it well. But if he is stopped in his re-
citation he becomes confused and "loses
the thread of his discourse whereupon he
must go back and start anew.
div.title: A Mhuillearstach

lg.l: 'S lalatha dha'n Fheinn eir Tullach Eirinn

div.p:
Note – much of this is difficult to understand.
The reciter is an old man (84) and his en
unciation is low and impaired. I had
much difficulty in writing this.

The reciter is a little man – not 5 ftfeet. I should
think. He is very active and all his faculties
unimpaired he is so active and in-
dustrious that I could hardly keep him
in from the cattle while writing this.

ClanClanranald was living in Beagram & a little
dautdaughter of his a few 3 years old when taken
away by Macmhuirich with whom
she livdlived till she was 19 or 21 yrsyears old. She
saw an aislig chaidil & told it

soiling her upon her. He twigged
that she was going to fall & that night
he went home with her to CCaisteal BBheagram & along

He hailed at Sgala nan calman

lady. That night itself a Morthir
each came with his rent & the girl

Her brobrother the oighre Iain or Ruari went out aftafter her & comcommitted

put into the stocks & thrown into stocks

Staoligearry was a tearmata & men
fled to it as a sanctuary. DonlDomhnall Gorm
mac Iain. DonlDomhnallGorm Og
was the men tiearnatighearna who used to tie ?nens
upon their beds & ship them off as slaves.
DonlDomhnall Gorm Mac Iain had a gre'eargreidhear
– a near relation of his own. The greargreidhear
was ploughploughing in May & the year being a
famine yryear he was in the habit of sendsending
home his own food to his childrchildren. He
liftlifted some brisgeanin & put them in his
pocket & ate one. At this time the grdground
was divdivided & turnturned for brisgeanin. DonlDomhnall
Gorm was looking out throthrough a window

He went to the bean fhuinfhuineadair
& asked her if she gave food to the gre-
eargreidhear today. "Yes." I'll know the truth of that
& he went down & without saysaying a workword
thrust his sgian fhada throthrough the mans
neck & he fell dead. He was opopened & no food
only the brisgbrisgeanan upon in his stomach.

Sithein a Bhealaich. This old woman

naich nach buin dha'n tsaoltsaoghal so

She saw the Loireag dīol sucking

the cow was so bent – upon givggiving her milk

she never heeded his sticks till it occurred
to him to strike her on the tip of the horn
which broke the charm & she moved away.
The Loireag moved away also singing

And

page was burburied alive & saw the daoine mi
thalamhaithalmhaidh carrcarry the stones to where the
church now stands. Another versversion – Twas
prophesied that a man must be burburied
alive in the plplace So Miltons page was to be
burburied as the lot came upon him but ananother
went in his plplace –

Caibeal Mhoire Nunton
A man who was drowned at BarrBarra
& whose body was fodfound at Nunton was
the first burdburied there.

LaoiLaoidh DhuilDhughaill Liosadair
Cairistina ninnighean DuilDhugaill (Nic Aonais)
Creagorry Benbecula Friday
16 June 1876

lg.l: Cluinn a dhuine bi nad fhaicill
Mu'n tuit cadail orstortsa deiseil
Eisd an trump s thoir an aire
Guth nan ai'ealaingeal tintighinn gad dhusgadhusgadh
Ga socair thu eir a leabaileabaidh
Cuimhnich gu h-aighearrh-aithghearr an uine
S ma tha curam orstort ga t anam
ErichEirich gu h-ealamh s gagabh t-urnuigh
Chan i an uirniurnaigh ghoirid fhionnar
CuinichCuimhnich a dhuindhuine ni cuis duinn
Ach an uirnurnaigh ni dhuidhuinn buinigbuinnig
Gus an guil thu eir d shuilean
Mu ni an urniurnaigh le crideadhcreideadh
Cha'n eagal nach fhein an eisdeaceisdeachd
Thig le duracdurachd do lucluchd teagasg
S thoir freiteach nach dian uthu eacoireucoir
CuinichCuimhnich eir boidean a bhaistibhaistidh
Gur a fastadh siod dan geil thu
Mar treig thu roideanrathaidean a pheacaidh
Glacar an ionad na pein thu
Gu ionad na pein a sheacnadh
Iosa ghlachadh chun ar giulain
Cum na faintean s treig an cleacdhcleachdadh
Ris an rorobh am peacpeacadh gad lubadh
'S ga nanach strioc thu dh ionnsuidh'ionnsaidh riaghailt
Le d cheann lau irstlabhairt briarachbriathrach beulach
Gu mor a chuis eagail Dia dhuit
NuirNuair thig d fhiachan eir a bhialaobhbhialaibh
Gach aon ni gheall thu na bha iarraidh
Gun do dhiult thu dha ri a dheanamh
S do chuiseaschuinnseas a togail fianais
Eir gach gniamh a chuir droch sgeul ort
Taing us moladh gu ro gu siorruisiorruidh
Gu rorobh Dia dhuinn iociochd sa riaghailt
S on nach b urrain sinsinn s na fiachfiachan
Gun do dh orduich Criost am paidheadh
Criost eir caaircathair a cheartais
DiolaiDiolaidh ris gach neach mar a tha iad
S gu h araid o fhuair e masladh
Bha ad le tal tailceas ga aicheadh
An Ti dh fhuilgfhuiling a chorp a cheusadh
Sa reubreubadh le sleagh s le tartairnean
Dhoirt fuil a chuim gu frasach
Gu sinn thoirt a steach gu aros
Thig le fuasfuathas churchuireas sgreamh oirnn
S gur diocairdeacair ailisaithris mar dh-eireas
TreigTreigidh muir us tir us talamh
S du'aidubhaidh a ghealghealach na speurann
Du'aiDubhaidh a ghrian a ni coineilcoinneal
Gun teid teine ris na sleiteansleibhtean
Thig an SlainearSlanaighear fo na bonnaibh
Cumail coincoinnimh ris an reulta
CuirCuirear fios eir sluasluagh na cruinecruinne
S theid an cruincruinneachadh le trumpaid
Theid an ci'alceangal suas an ordan
Eadar fhuil us fheoil us fheithean
S laidir cumhcumhachadh an urra
Chuir ad uile gu cuntaiscunntais
Chuir anam anns gach coluincolluinn
Tha tuiteam nan toruntorran urachuireach
Bheir an talamh cuntaiscunntais seachdseachad
Corp gach duine fhuair e fhefhein dhiudhiubh
Bith an fhairge cuntaiscunntais daonnan
Corp gach aon a fhuair i fhefhein dhiudhiubh
Nuair a theid ad eir bialaobh barra barra)
Gu rorobh n t anam a toirt reusan
Gu rorobh ad nan spiorad neo locachneo-lochdach
Gus na thruaill an corp o cheud fhear
San'S ann bu choireach ris na suilean
Gun a lubadh gu farmad
Gun rorobh ad a diandeanamh cairst shuilcairt-iuil dhabhdhaibh
Anns gach cuis gu'n rorobh e ainmeil
Cha be na suilean bu choireach
Ach an cricrithe foileilfoilleil fautachfalltach
G iarraiarraidh ann air cuid gach duine
Ga b' ann am mulmullach nam beann e
Tha dorcha gun bhi soilleir
Tha lan a choillchoille mheallta
Tha e g iarraiiarraidh chun a pheacaipheacaidh
Tha e lubach carrach sanntach
Sa dhiaoindhaoine a tha ri ratharadha
Tha e 'n trast na a'oraobhar diumba
Cha diandeanadh adsan a bheirt ad
Mar bhi na casun gan giulan
A dhaoindhaoine sin a rinn an ceastasceartas
Thig sibh is teach gu ao aros
GheoGheobh sibh flaanasflathanas mar uaisle
Mar tha guth an uain a grathinag radhainn
Sa dhaoine mas ann le Dia sibh
BeanBeannachd Dhia leibh s tiontionndaidh trath ris
San bu choir ris na la airlathair
DianDeanamh gach gnothgnothaich falachfalachaidh
Goid sa braid na dh-fhaod ad fhaighinn
SpuilSpuilleadh thaighean murstmurt us mar adhmarbhadh

div.p:
Thainic trance eir Dual Liosadair
agus san a rinn e an laoilaoidh seo.
Sann san EilEilean Sgiathanach a
bha an duine.

lg.l: 'S e chualas guth thuirt rium gu supli
O chuir mi mo shaoir ri lathair
Chan nil do cheile ach a ghearr
An duine sin a dhealdhealaich ruibh an de
Bha or us airgiod dol seach agus
Tha e diuan-diugh gun choramchothrom facail spli
A bheirteas threig
LaiLaighidh mi nocnochd le Moire 's le Mac
le maicmac mo righ gam dhion o gach olc
LaiLaighidh mi le Dia laid Dia liom
ChaiCha lailaigh mi leis an olc s chaicha lailaighi an
t olc liom
Crois an naoimh bial Di bhrithneasbhruidhneas
Ai'ealAingeal geal anns gach dorus
Gu'n tig solus geal am maireach.

div.p:
Sorcha an Orfhuilt – an ighean
chaichaidh am fiadhan eir na feidh.
From Duncan Macdonald, Snaoisval

Bha e san dailgneacdailgneachd gun readhreachadh an nighean
dachdachaidh leis agus gun caochaileodhcaochladh i na thaigh

The girl was also called Biorach Fionna
nam Fiadh." So says the Mr Alexander
Campbell priest Bornish SSouth Uist
Binneach nam Fiadh (?) – Beann (?)
Bheir buimilear breith ach co bheir ceart.
Binneach nam beann
